newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - June 4.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - June 4.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - Taiwan to grant amnesty to 1947 massacre survivors.
President Lee Teng-hui, Premier Lien Chan seek internal support for constitutional amendments.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - Taiwan bans local firms to invest in mainland real estate, power projects.
Members of ruling Nationalist Party and opposition Democratic Progressive Party sharply divided over constitutional revisions.
LIBERTY TIMES - President Lee Teng-hui agrees to grant amnesty to massacre victims.
Lee Teng-hui says decision to freeze all elections at provincial government level not intended to promote Taiwan independence.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - Winbond Electronics Corp gets T$3.03 billion for fire loss.
Taiwan decides to gradually raise business tax.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - Winbond gets gets T$3.03 billion for fire loss.
Liquidity tightens in the banking system.
